attributes.action: ensure that any website launched by the government complies with accessibility standards (WCAG AA at least).
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In June 2006 the DTI launched their new website. Despite an approximate cost of £200,000, the website failed to meet basic accessibility standards. In short, this meant that the information on the website was inaccessible to some UK citizens - this is absolutely inexcusable. Further work (requiring further taxpayer money) was promised to bring the website up to Level AA of the Web Accessibility Initiative. The purpose of this petition is to ensure that all future government websites meet basic accessibility requirements from launch.
